Health & Safety Guidelines
Casey N Spaz Comedy Presents
OMGITSWICKS and Friends Comedy Event
Saturday, Jan  3, 2026
at  8:00pm
Buy Tickets
With millions of followers across social media and a voice as loud as a Florida thunderstorm, viral content creator and comedian OMGITSWICKS, aka Josh Robinson, is taking the internet—and the Sunshine State—by storm. Known for his Florida-specific sketches, OMGITSWICKS has carved out a niche as the unofficial spokesperson for the hilarious chaos that is Florida life.
With a loyal following on TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, OMGITSWICKS has become a must-watch creator for anyone who’s ever lived in, visited, or just heard about Florida.
OMGITSWICKS is more than a content creator—he’s a comedic force capturing the culture of Florida like no one else. Also performing:
Myke Herlihy (Florida’s Funniest Comedian 2023 Winner)  is also appearing at The Surprise Comedy show 2 10-25-25 with Casey and Spaz
Dewayne Williams (Funny Not Famous)
Casey Peruski (Dry Bar Comedy)  and Spaz McGoorty  (Pure Zeppelin )
Please note: The presenter and/or host of this production has privately leased The Lyric. Lyric Management is not responsible for the program or its content.
Saturday, Jan  3, 2026
at  8:00pm
Buy Tickets

Health & Safety Guidelines
Membership and Perks
PATRON PERKS PROVIDER DIRECTORY
Membership Levels and Benefits:
Friend ($50)
• Purchase four (4) tickets in advance for each show presented by The Lyric Theatre.*
Family ($100)
• Purchase eight (8) tickets in advance for each show presented by The Lyric Theatre.*
• Lyric’s “Patron Privilege Card,” which offers a variety of discounts at many local restaurants and shops.
Bronze ($250)
• Purchase unlimited tickets in advance for each show presented by The Lyric Theatre.*
• Two (2) drink vouchers for The Lyric Bar.
Silver ($500)
• Purchase unlimited tickets in advance for each show presented by The Lyric Theatre.*
• Ticketing service hotline for priority seating one (1) week in advance of our Season announce to all membership
• Four (4) drink vouchers for The Lyric Bar.
Gold ($1000)
• Purchase unlimited tickets in advance for each show presented by The Lyric Theatre.*
• Ticketing service hotline for priority seating two (2) weeks in advance of our Season announce to all membership.
• Four (4) drink vouchers for The Lyric Bar.
• Behind the Scenes Private Tour.
Platinum ($2500)
• All Gold benefits plus an invitation to a private reception.
To become a member, call Heather Long, Development Director, at (772) 220-1942, x 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
*Subject to availability
Director’s Circle:
Our prestigious Director’s Circle offers you an opportunity to support The Lyric through a flexible sustained giving program. The majority of Director’s Circle members prefer to make annual payments over five (5) years, although others decide to honor their commitment by making their payment for a shorter period of time or in one payment. It’s entirely up to you.
A minimum commitment of $2,500 or more annually.
The Director’s Circle Wall in the lobby prominently displays all individual and corporate members. The size of the engraved nameplate is commensurate with the total commitment.
Personal Concierge Box Office Service is provided which ensures Director’s Circle members receive first notification of the new season as well as all added shows. This helps secure the best seats for the shows of their choice.
Concierge level advantages also include full no-charge cancellation and exchange privileges.
During the season, members are invited to exclusive Director’s Circle parties.
Director’s Circle members are prominently listed on a full-page in each issue of the quarterly Lyric magazine.
To learn more about our sustained giving program, contact Heather Long, Development Director at 772-220-1942, extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
Be sure to
visit our Patron Perks Providers
to redeem your perks and to thank the merchants who support The Lyric Theatre!

The Weight Band – Featuring members of The Band and the Levon Helm Band
Thursday, Jan 22, 2026
at  7:00pm
Buy Tickets
The Band was one of the most important roots rock groups of the 1960s. The influential group, which included Levon Helm, Rick Danko, Garth Hudson, Richard Manuel and Robbie Robertson, began in Canada and then migrated to the U.S. It was the subject of a Martin Scorsese documentary The Last Waltz. The group was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1994. In 2004, Rolling Stone ranked The Band 50 on the list of 100 greatest artists and the song “The Weight” was ranked 41st on the magazine’s list of the 500 greatest songs. It is a storied history.
Levon Helm died in 2012 after a lengthy battle with throat cancer that kept him from performing for many years. In 2013, in the Woodstock barn Levon Helm loved, Jim Weider and Randy Ciarlante, both former members of The Band, performed “Songs of the Band” with founder Garth Hudson, Jimmy Vivino and Byron Isaacs.
The experience inspired Weider, Ciarlante and Isaacs to carry on The Band’s legacy and they began performing fan favorites. They invited Brian Mitchell and later added Albert Rogers, Michael Bram and Matt Zeiner to join them. “We started doing some songs and people got excited,” Weider said. “We put The Weight Band together and people were so happy to hear the songs again. Then we wanted to do an original album.”
In 2018, they released an album of original material, World Gone Mad, that captured The Band’s musical tradition but was put together for today’s vibrant Americana base. The album is an Americana/Roots Rock tribute to the music and the Woodstock sound. Goldmine magazine called it “one of the year’s best indie albums.”
The group’s 2022 album Shines Like Gold drew on roadhouse rock, funky swamp pop, blues, country soul and folk music. It was recorded live at Clubhouse Studios in Rhinebeck, New York, over four days during the height of the pandemic. The band looked at our troubled world, pondered the passage of time, and ultimately conveyed a sense of hopefulness for the future. “There’s a new dawn rising,” they proclaimed on the title track, “and it shines like gold.”
The Weight Band is composed of band leader, renowned guitarist Jim Weider (The Band, Levon Helm’s Midnight Ramble Band, Jim Weider Band), keyboardist Brian Mitchell (Levon Helm’s Midnight Ramble Band), bassist Albert Rogers (Jim Weider Band, Jimmy Vivino), drummer Michael Bram (Jason Mraz) and keyboardist Matt Zeiner (Dickey Betts). The veteran quintet shares a deep appreciation and knowledge for the music they play, which Weider describes as the “Woodstock Sound.” The Weight Band continues to serve as its torchbearer with Shines Like Gold representing a sublime example of these masterful roots musicians at work.
Choosing the name of the band was an homage to the legendary song they made so famous. “’The Weight’ will be a song in spaceships on the moon,” Weider said. “It’s a classic song that defined American culture at the time and still does. The Band was the beginning of Americana. They were the first Americana band and they cross-pollinated all the music and put it in a big pot.”
Replicating the music of the Band would be a tall order, but interpreting it is an art. The songs The Band created have pleased audiences for decades, and The Weight Band has found a way to honor the legacy while creating its own sound with original works that complement that legacy.
Take a load off and come hear the music that defined an era.
Thursday, Jan 22, 2026
at  7:00pm

Ways to Support The Lyric
What Role Will You Play?
When you support The Lyric Theatre, you play a leading role in our commitment to provide the community
with affordable ticket prices, expand cultural and arts education programming while preserving our historic landmark.
Ticket sales cover less than one-half of The Lyric’s artist fees, production costs and operating expenses like most not-for-profit performing arts venues. Memberships and donations are tax-deductible and help us to provide the community with a home for the performing arts that enhances the quality of life, educates and inspires our youth, and supports the local economy.
Become a Director’s Circle Member!
Join our prestigious sustained giving program and you’ll enjoy many exclusive benefits such as first opportunities to buy tickets for new shows, personal concierge ticketing services, exclusive parties and recognition in the lobby and of course, The Lyric’s endless gratitude! Contact Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
for complete information.
Maximize Your Corporate Visibility & Recognition
to thousands of Lyric patrons as a Corporate Partner. Corporate Partnership also demonstrates the support and commitment your corporation has for the community as well as its willingness to invest in The Lyric as one of the most prominent cultural institutions on the Treasure Coast. Contact Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
to customize a Corporate Sponsorship package to fit your business needs!
Sponsor a Show!
As an individual or a business, you can have a Starring Role if you choose to sponsor a show! There are great benefits of sponsoring including complimentary tickets, drink vouchers, recognition for you and/or your company, an ad in The Lyric magazine, invitations to a Season Wrap Up Party and many other important perks depending on which of three levels you choose. An Artist Meet & Greet may even be possible!  Let’s talk … Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
for complete information.
Become a Founding Member of the Lyric Legacy Society
…and it won’t cost you a penny to join today! The Lyric Legacy Society has been created by the incredible generosity of several very special patrons who have chosen to include The Lyric in their planned giving by directing a portion of their assets to the Theatre. If you Love The Lyric too and have supported “her” during her incredible 98-year-history – regardless of your level of support – let’s meet over coffee, lunch … phone calls and email work too but aren’t as much fun as meeting in person! You can reach Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
for more information.
Members enjoy the “Fast Pass” to Great Seats!
Becoming a Member of The Lyric has never been easier and annual membership begins at only $50!
Member benefits include being able to:
Purchase tickets
in advance of the general public
Enjoy discounts
at many
local restaurants and businesses
Receive advance notice
of upcoming shows and events
Contact Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
for more information
Give a Gift Certificate!
We have just the ticket for you if you’re looking for that extra special gift for that extra special someone! You won’t have to wonder if it’s the right size, color or style. Gift Certificates are perfect for everyone on your list! Visit the Box Office or call 772.286.7827 … then relax. You’re shopping is done!
Make a Donation!
We love and appreciate every donation since no donation is too large or too small. Donations are needed, welcomed and truly appreciated every day.  You may conveniently make a donation on our website or by contacting Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
Support Arts & Education -- help Inspire the Leaders of Tomorrow!
You can choose to help educate our youth, bring families together and open young minds by being a valued Sponsor of one of these incredible Lyric Arts & Education Programs:
Artist Residency
or
Master Class
– Professional artists visit local schools for an intensive, up-close and personal experience. By working closely with the artists, students are encouraged to investigate their own creative potential and develop a life-long appreciation of the arts.
Summer Camp
– More than 1.400 children from all backgrounds and interests, grades 1st – 8th, have enjoyed The Lyric’s AWESOME! Summer Camp. Each three-week session supports a theme to promote teamwork, self-discipline, problem solving, tolerance and kindness. It has proven to be a powerful platform in encouraging socially responsible behavior but to the kids, it’s “just plain
FUN!
”
The Discovery Series
– For more than 22 years, The Discovery Series for Young Audiences has provided thousands of school children across the Treasure Coast an opportunity to experience the wonder of live theater – many of them for the first time. The Discovery Series is comprised of professionally produced, high quality shows that educate, inspire and entertain students.
If you’d like more information or would like to discuss specific needs of each program, contact Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
.
Get Your Message Out … Advertise!
The Lyric Magazine
is beautifully printed in full color on glossy stock and packed with information about The Lyric’s lineup of shows updated throughout the season. It’s the perfect advertising opportunity for your company to show your support for the arts and allows patrons to become familiar with your business! For more information, contact Mike Renfro at
palmcity5@yahoo.com
Become a Patron Perks Provider!
Join other successful and innovative area businesses in offering incentives and discounted services to our members at the Family level and above. Thousands of your potential customers are visiting downtown Stuart on their way to -- or from -- The Lyric. Get in on this action by becoming a Patron Perks Provider! For more information contact Heather Long, Development Director, 772.220.1942 extension 209 or
development@lyrictheatre.com
.
Become a Valued Volunteer!
Our dedicated volunteer
Ushers
and
Bartenders
are vitally important to The Lyric, not only because they perform hours of service, but because they also provide their energy and expertise to ensure that Lyric patrons have a memorable and enjoyable theatre experience.  To find out more about being a Volunteer, contact
volunteer@lyrictheatre.com
